intro: Sidalcea cusickii, commonly known as Cusick's checker-mallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. This species is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It is a perennial herb with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves.
